attributes.action: Cap the amount that can be lent by a mortgage lender to a borrower at 5 (five) times single or combined salary over a maximum of 25 years.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Mortgage lenders who are willing to lend 7 (seven) or more times an individual's or a couple's salary over, increasingly, 25, 30 and even up to 50 years are responsible for the spiralling cost of house purchasing in the UK. Capping both loan amounts and length of loan repayments, together, will, necessarily, slow house price rises and will give future generations a chance of home ownership.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
